intro: Eschscholzia lemmonii subsp. kernensis, commonly known as the Kern County poppy, is a flowering plant native to California. It is a member of the Papaveraceae family and is characterized by its striking red-orange petals and yellow stamens. This subspecies typically grows in rocky soils and is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and hillsides. It blooms in the spring and is known for its ornamental value. The plant is also of ecological importance, providing nectar for pollinators and serving as a food source for certain wildlife.
